s.text: We welcome scrutiny into our advertising campaign and our organization, but here's one suggestion: How about waiting for some results before deciding this can't possibly work, and how about reading the existing research that shows it can ("The Impact of Anti-Drug Advertising," Johns Hopkins University; "Does Anti-Drug Advertising Work," New York University's Stern School of Business)?

6. Pollitt and Sullivan alike deem me insensitive to the depth and complexity of the psyche, and Sullivan warmly endorses psychoanalyst Jonathan Lear's admonition that we dare not reject Freud lest those qualities drop out of sight.

6. Pollitt and Sullivan alike deem me insensitive to the depth and complexity of the psyche, and Sullivan warmly endorses psychoanalyst Jonathan Lear's admonition that we dare not reject Freud lest those qualities drop out of sight.

6. Pollitt and Sullivan alike deem me insensitive to the depth and complexity of the psyche, and Sullivan warmly endorses psychoanalyst Jonathan Lear's admonition that we dare not reject Freud lest those qualities drop out of sight.

6. Pollitt and Sullivan alike deem me insensitive to the depth and complexity of the psyche, and Sullivan warmly endorses psychoanalyst Jonathan Lear's admonition that we dare not reject Freud lest those qualities drop out of sight.
I have never attacked psychotherapy, by which I mean the general enterprise of helping people talk through their anxieties and face the difficulties in their immediate circumstances.

Only when we have grasped the full extent of the Freudian intellectual fiasco--it is adumbrated in my book but exhaustively explored in Malcolm Macmillan's Freud Evaluated: The Completed Arc (1997)--will we be able to talk about motives with an adequate respect for their actual variety and volatility.
Did you forget to send me the e-mail about your buyout by Vanity Fair ? Is name recognition now the primary requirement for publication?
Did you forget to send me the e-mail about your buyout by Vanity Fair ? Is name recognition now the primary requirement for publication?

And it is not fair to criticize Janet Maslin for praising Lethal Weapon 4 while suppressing the information that I, for example, disliked it, because that would not help his case--just as the information that Maslin disliked many of the other films he mentions would also not serve his thesis.
Quite simply, my book asks whether it was attained with or without the benefit of accurate clinical observation, defensible drawing of inferences, and encouraging therapeutic results.
